dialogue_turns.text: You mean the digitalization part? Because, like, everyone has been saying the pandemic accelerated digital transformation.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: You mean the digitalization part? Because, like, everyone has been saying the pandemic accelerated digital transformation.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly! But this article argues the opposite. It says digitalization *won't* accelerate, um, and companies are actually reversing digital investments.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly! But this article argues the opposite. It says digitalization won't accelerate, um, and companies are actually reversing digital investments.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The second, and perhaps the most obvious, lesson of the pandemic crisis is that digitalization will accelerate. Spurred by the need to accommodate remote working, we are living in an increasingly dematerialized world.

dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, it's suggesting we're living in an "increasingly material world" and that Zoom calls make physical presence mandatory. Which, like, doesn't even make sense to me.
